[color=#0000BF]Game Rules:
These rules are to be followed at all times. Failure to do so may result in disciplinary action ranging from a warning to being force-replaced or modkilled.

i) This is a game so try and have fun! Don't be mean to other users by flaming, trolling or calling names. Remember the general site rules apply at all times!
ii) No trickery: No invisible, encrypted, or small text in thread.
iii) You may not edit or delete any posts, if you have the power to do so.
iv) Don't discuss this game outside of the main thread, unless your role specifies you have the permission to do so.
v) Do not quote role PMs or any information said in PTs/QTs outside the related threads. Paraphrasing is allowed, but I would recommend you run it through me first before you do so.
vi) Do not impersonate the mod in-thread. Do not use my mod colour, #0000BF.
vii) Faking a violation will give you the same penalty as actually committing it.


Game Mechanics
The information below describes how the game works. Some of these modified from various other people.

i) Votes must be bolded, or made using the vote tags. Either Vote: Cheetory6 or VOTE: Cheetory6 is acceptable. On the other hand, if it looks vaguely like a vote, I'll count it.
ii) Lynches require a majority of votes. If a majority is not reached by deadline no lynch occurs.
iii) Once a lynch occurs, the game enters twilight and players may continue to talk in thread until the death scene has been posted. No votes/unvotes will be counted during this period.
iv) Once you're dead, you're dead. No more talking. No 'Bah' posts.
v) All actions will be resolved using the Natural Action Resolution system.
vi) Each Day will have a two week (14 day) deadline. Deadline extensions don't happen unless on extraordinary circumstances.
vii) Each Night will have a 48 hour (2 day) deadline. All night actions must be submitted to me (Cheetory6) by PM during that time.
viii) If you're going to be V/LA, please notify me in thread (preferably bolded with @mod or @Cheetory).
ix) Players must post every 48 hours or they will be prodded. Three total prods during the game will result in a replacement. If a player fails to pick up on their prod and post in-game within 24 hours, they will be replaced also. Players who are V/LA are exempt from this.
x) All flavour is provided purely for entertainment purposes only and has no bearing or relation to the game.


Sample Role PM
At least one player has received a 'vanilla town' PM like the one below:

Vanilla Townie - Good Dream
Welcome to the game, Cheetory6! You are a Vanilla Townie, aligned with the town. Please confirm your role by replying to this PM.

Abilities
You have no special abilities.

Win Condition
You win when all threats to the town are eliminated.


Important Links
1.00 1.01 1.02 1.03 1.04 1.05 1.06 1.07 1.08 1.09 1.10 1.11 1.12 1.13 1.14 1.15 1.LYNCH

I really liked the matrix concept in my newbie game; I thought it was a nice framework on which to hang my thought process. And I thought this game would end up being just like one of the newbie games (i.e. with announced PMs and a matrix), just with more people. I guess I was wrong. No biggie though, I'll adapt.

In terms of how I will proceed, I guess I will have a much larger space to search through mentally when trying to make reads. Right now the space feels so large that I am not sure how I will proceed. But each mafia game I've played has taught me something and I am sure this will be no exception.
Weird though that we don't even know how many scum there are.  For all I know we could be in LYLO right now.  What a strange concept.

Balancing Mafia games is an art unto itself. However, in general a Mafia should make up about 20% to 25% of your initial population of players. The number of total scum in the game CAN go up to 33% of the total players if the Town is particularly strong, but this 33% usually does not come from one faction.


(http://wiki.mafiascum.net/index.php?title=Mafia)

In post 26, VictorDeAngelo wrote:Also, wondering if I really buy that a player, even a newbie, can believe a Day 1 lylo setup was possible. Bji, outside of games you've played, have you read any other games on this site?


My question was somewhat facetious, intended to illustrate the general concept of "holy shit anything is anything really possible?!?". I do not expect that the game has been set up in some completely pointless manner such as a setup that would give a 90% chance that the game ends on the first mislynch. Or that there are 12 doctors and 1 scum.

However, I truly do not understand the limits of what is possible in this setup. It has been suggested that I go and look at completed games to get an understanding of what is typical. However, even that does not fully prepare me for what is possible in this game as we could be playing something truly unique.

Anyway, I'll stop wasting everyone's time with this line of discussion now. I'll go find out what I can be reading the wiki.

In post 26, VictorDeAngelo wrote:Bji, outside of games you've played, have you read any other games on this site?


And to answer your direct question, I have never read any games other than the ones I have played in. I have played in two games total in the newbie queue of this site, and that is the entire sum of my experience with the game of mafia in any form.

You may wonder why I wouldn't have read any prior games. Well, to be honest, I think the concept sounds ridiculously boring, and also the idea of having to read prior games in order to gain a competitive advantage (knowing player meta, etc) is distasteful to me, because it then feels like some aspects of the game become about who is willing to waste more time reading old game threads to get that advantage, and that's just not a game I want to play. Thus far I have patently refused to read prior game threads for the purposes of researching someone's meta, even when directly asked to by the IC whom I had a lynch vote on.

However, I would make an exception to my personal rule about not reading old game threads if the purpose was to actually inform myself about the game setup. Not having any clue of the game setup and having to ask questions about it is just going to waste people's time. And I'm already somewhat sorry that I've done so here, because I'm sure it's irritating some people already.

OK, setup analyse time:

Town
1 1-shot vig
1 Jailer
1(?) Informed Townie
1(?) Neighbouriser
6-7 vt

Scum
2 mafia goons
1 ???

I am somewhat unsure about whether there is a single normal scum role (it has to be normal as PK has the one non-normal role allowed) that could balance this game. Particularly since the main scum roles of benefit would investigative roles (which cc PK anyway).

Goon, Godfather, Encryptor, Strongman, Ninja, Traitor

Well goon gives the mafia a mountainous setup against a heavily powered town, so let's rule that out. Traitor is worse than goon, so let's rule that out as well. Ninja and godfather are irrelevent with the town roles present. Strongman would somewhat bastardly against a jailkeeper in a game with no investigative roles. Encryptor seems unlikely just because of how bad the scum did day 1 (no way TMJ plays that way if his buddies are on hand to guide him). So what's left. Either the scum had a protection role to prevent the vigshot (which I'd surprised by) or they had a jack of all trades (which didn't have any investigative roles). I can't rule the last four options definitively, but my guy says no.

On the other hand, let's put Pisskop into the scum column. Suddenly the informed role makes more sense. Why tell the town they are short in power? Just in case bold scum claim cop. Seems weak and dare I say unnessecary. However, compare that information value to scum. Suddenly, knowing the town has no investigative, gives them a good chance of cracking the setup, and leaves them open some counterclaims.

tl:dr Informed scum balances against the town powers better against the other three town powers better than I can see a single scum role balancing against the combination of the other four.

And yeah, before Pisskop or someone else says, I am essentially declaring Ari town to make this jump. I don't think that's bad leap at all at this point.

Pisskop attempt to use the views in the nieghbourhood also feels pretty scummmy to me.

So how about instead of no lynching, people at least make their case about who they want to lynch. Because the whole 1/5 and 1/3 is better than 1/6 then 1/4 argument for no lynching only makes sense if we were sitting around here with everyone being an equal lynch, and I don't believe that is the case.
